eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.items

Class AbstractFlexibleItem<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.items.AbstractFlexibleItem<VH>
  • Type Parameters:
    VH - RecyclerView.ViewHolder
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFlexible<VH>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractExpandableItem, AbstractHeaderItem, AbstractSectionableItem

    public abstract class AbstractFlexibleItem<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFlexible<VH>
    Generic implementation of IFlexible interface with most useful methods to manage selection and view holder methods.
    Since:
    20/01/2016 Created
    21/04/2017 ViewHolders methods are now abstract
    08/12/2017 New callback methods when view is attached/detached/recycled
    22/04/2018 Item is born with draggable and swipeable enabled

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public abstract boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        You MUST implement this method to compare items unique identifiers.

        Adapter needs this method to distinguish them and pick up correct items.

        See Writing a correct equals method to implement your own equals method.

        Hint: If you don't use unique IDs, reimplement with Basic Java implementation: 

         public boolean equals(Object o) {
     return this == o;
 }

        Important Note: When used with Hash[Map,Set], the general contract for the equals and Object.hashCode() methods is that if equals returns true for any two objects, then hashCode() must return the same value for these objects. This means that subclasses of Object usually override either both methods or neither of them.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - instance to compare
        Returns:
        true if items are equals, false otherwise.

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden()
        Description copied from interface: IFlexible
        (Internal usage). When and item has been deleted (with Undo) or has been filtered out by the adapter, then, it has hidden status.
        Specified by:
        isHidden in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Returns:
        true for hidden item, (default) false for the shown one.

      • getSpanSize

        public int getSpanSize(int spanCount,
                       int position)
        Description copied from interface: IFlexible
        Individual item's span size to use only with GridLayoutManager.

        Note:

        • Default implementation in AbstractFlexibleItem already returns 1.
        • Not used when StaggeredGridLayoutManager is set. With such layout use FlexibleViewHolder.setFullSpan(boolean).

        Specified by:
        getSpanSize in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        spanCount - current column count
        position - the adapter position of the item
        Returns:
        the number of span occupied by the item at position.

      • shouldNotifyChange

        public boolean shouldNotifyChange(IFlexible newItem)
        Description copied from interface: IFlexible
        Called by the FlexibleAdapter when it wants to check if this item should be bound again with new content.

        You should return true whether you want this item will be updated because its visual representations will change.

        Note: This method won't be called if FlexibleAdapter.setNotifyChangeOfUnfilteredItems(boolean) is disabled.

        Default value is true.

        Specified by:
        shouldNotifyChange in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        newItem - The new item object with the new content
        Returns:
        True will trigger a new binding to display new content, false if the content shown is already the latest data.

      • getBubbleText

        public java.lang.String getBubbleText(int position)
        Description copied from interface: IFlexible
        Custom bubble text for FastScroller.

        To be called from the implementation of onCreateBubbleText(). Example: 

         public String onCreateBubbleText(int position) {
     return getItem(position).getBubbleText(position);
 }

        Specified by:
        getBubbleText in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        position - the current mapped position
        Returns:
        Any desired value

      • getItemViewType

        public int getItemViewType()
        Identifies a specific view type for this item, used by FlexibleAdapter to auto-map the ViewTypes.

        HELP: To know how to implement AutoMap for ViewTypes please refer to the FlexibleAdapter Wiki Page on GitHub.

        If not overridden return value is the same of getLayoutRes().

        Specified by:
        getItemViewType in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Returns:
        user defined item view type identifier or layout reference if not overridden

      • getLayoutRes

        public abstract int getLayoutRes()
        Returns the layout resource ID to auto-inflate the View for this item. Optionally, you can assign same layout for multiple item types, but IFlexible.getItemViewType() must return unique values!

        NOTE: Should identify a resource Layout reference R.layout.

        Specified by:
        getLayoutRes in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Returns:
        layout identifier

      • createViewHolder

        public abstract VH createViewHolder(android.view.View view,
                                    FlexibleAdapter<IFlexible> adapter)
        Delegates the creation of the ViewHolder to the user (AutoMap).

        HELP: To know how to implement AutoMap for ViewTypes please refer to the FlexibleAdapter Wiki Page on GitHub.

        Specified by:
        createViewHolder in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        view - the already inflated view
        adapter - the Adapter instance extending FlexibleAdapter
        Returns:
        a new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type

      • bindViewHolder

        public abstract void bindViewHolder(FlexibleAdapter<IFlexible> adapter,
                                    VH holder,
                                    int position,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.Object> payloads)
        Delegates the binding of this item's data to the given Layout.

        HELP: To know how to implement AutoMap for ViewTypes please refer to the FlexibleAdapter Wiki Page on GitHub.

        How to use Payload, please refer to RecyclerView.Adapter#onBindViewHolder(RecyclerView.ViewHolder, int, List).
        Specified by:
        bindViewHolder in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        adapter - the FlexibleAdapter instance
        holder - the ViewHolder instance
        position - the current position
        payloads - a non-null list of merged payloads. Can be empty list if requires full update

      • unbindViewHolder

        public void unbindViewHolder(FlexibleAdapter<IFlexible> adapter,
                             VH holder,
                             int position)
        Called when a view created by this adapter has been recycled.

        A view is recycled when a RecyclerView.LayoutManager decides that it no longer needs to be attached to its parent RecyclerView. This can be because it has fallen out of visibility or a set of cached views represented by views still attached to the parent RecyclerView.

        If an item view has large or expensive data bound to it such as large bitmaps, this may be a good place to release those resources.
        Specified by:
        unbindViewHolder in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        adapter - the FlexibleAdapter instance
        holder - the ViewHolder instance being recycled
        position - the current position

      • onViewAttached

        public void onViewAttached(FlexibleAdapter<IFlexible> adapter,
                           VH holder,
                           int position)
        Called when a view created by this adapter has been attached to a window.

        This can be used as a reasonable signal that the view is about to be seen by the user.

        Specified by:
        onViewAttached in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        adapter - the FlexibleAdapter instance
        holder - the ViewHolder instance being recycled
        position - the current position

      • onViewDetached

        public void onViewDetached(FlexibleAdapter<IFlexible> adapter,
                           VH holder,
                           int position)
        Called when a view created by this adapter has been detached from its window.

        Becoming detached from the window is not necessarily a permanent condition; the consumer of an Adapter's views may choose to cache views offscreen while they are not visible, attaching and detaching them as appropriate.

        Specified by:
        onViewDetached in interface IFlexible<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        adapter - the FlexibleAdapter instance
        holder - the ViewHolder instance being recycled
        position - the current position
